channel.title: Music on aron online!
channel.description: Recent content in Music on aron online!

item.title: au5
item.description: from: united states years active: 2010-present stream/buy: soundcloud, bandcamp electronic music pioneer au5 in 2012. (image source: wikipedia) genre-defining, masterful, and impactful are all words i would use to describle au5’s music. his trademark combination of well-designed, rolling basses and rich melodic tones is easily recognizable among edm fans. he often utilizes dramatic vocalists to make each song feel grand and lofty. his sound design and mixing has become renowned, and his unique arrangements have spawned an entire recognizable style that many other artists have emulated in the edm scene.

item.title: beutnoise
item.description: from: cuba years active: 2019-present stream/buy: soundcloud, youtube dubstep producer beutnoise in 2022. (image source: instagram) the producer who completely revolutionized the genre of dubstep for me. the opposite of repetitive, his music is always chock full of crazy switchups and complex rhythms. his use of high-energy vocal samples adds character to his music, acting as recurring anchors to get me entranced in the flow. on top of that, his mixdowns are some of the cleanest in the scene, allowing for his creative ideas to shine through every song.

item.title: candid oak
item.description: from: norway years active: 2016-2017 (as konane), 2020-present (as candid oak) stream/buy: soundcloud, bandcamp my go-to feel-good producer. candid oak’s music strikes a perfect balance between complex, catchy flows and warm, comforting sounds. his songs constantly evolve, rarely staying in one place, making each song feel like an adventure. his organic and nature-inspired percussion, sound design, and vocal sampling are just so unique and never fail to inspire a happy mood within me.

item.title: culprate
item.description: from: united kingdom years active: 2008-present stream/buy: soundcloud, bandcamp culprate is something of an og in electronic music, and has been involved in the uk bass music scene since before the 2010s. much of his discography consists of old-school dubstep and a slow, bass-heavy subgenre called neurohop, neither of which i am particularly fond of. however, on certain projects, he brings a mind-bendingly intricate style of glitchy dance music that i just adore.

item.title: ekcle
item.description: from: united kingdom years active: 2016-2020 stream/buy: soundcloud, bandcamp ekcle before they split. members are david gotham (left) and tutara peak (right). (image source: soundcloud) no producers were able to meld the realms of synthetic and organic sound as well as ekcle. while complex in structure and nuanced in arrangement, they always managed to keep their music sounding warm, inviting, and catchy. their frequent use of the kalimba became an iconic motif cemented in their best songs.

item.title: hukae
item.description: from: united kingdom years active: 2019-present stream/buy: soundcloud hukae’s tracks feature permanently awkward flows, barebones arrangements, and strange sound design. ultimately, the variation in his ideas, paired with pristine percussion selection, make each hukae track extremely interesting. each track features a slew of subtle choices, such as slight switchups in rhythm or a different snare for a single beat, that keep me engaged throughout every drop. hukae concocted this unique dubstep style within just the last few years, previously being your average uk riddim artist.

item.title: jkuch
item.description: from: united states years active: 2013-present stream/buy: soundcloud, bandcamp jkuch in 2022. (image source: instagram) jkuch has a style completely distinct from any other musician i’ve ever heard. all of his sounds are self-processed and he is often his own vocalist, giving his songs a distinct palette that is easily recognizable. his music generally falls under the label of lush and melodic future bass, but his discography is so diverse in ideas that he is easily one of the artists i have spent the most time listening to over the years.

item.title: lalanoi
item.description: from: japan years active: 2019-present stream/buy: soundcloud, bandcamp lalanoi’s music is pure ear candy. everything he makes is completely beyond my comprehension, yet he somehow manages to combine some mind-boggling flows and arrangements into cohesive pieces. his songs have an insane level of detail that is not only incredibly impressive, but makes his music a delight to listen to every time. lalanoi is a mysterious producer from japan. since suddenly appearing in the soundcloud and doujin music scenes in 2019, he has become a revered legend within the soundcloud community, and for good reason.

item.title: quok
item.description: from: russia/czechia years active: 2013 - 2019 (as quok), 2018 - present (as куок) stream/buy: soundcloud, bandcamp a picture of quok. (image source) quok’s music aligns perfectly with my sensibilities. off-kilter beats, frequent glitches and flairs of sound design, and nuanced song structures are all elements of his songs that i enjoy. his production usually isn’t perfect, and oftentimes his english lyrics are rather odd. his discography contains recurring musical and lyrical motifs that persist across his various albums.

item.title: sharks
item.description: from: france years active: 2016-present stream/buy: soundcloud, youtube (cool music videos!) in my opinion, sharks is the best dubstep producer alive currently when it comes to mixing and production quality. his distinct ability to combine sharp drums with layers of insanely complex fluttery synths and basses makes his music hit incredibly hard. his frequent use of vocal samples adds flow and a factor of catchiness to his tracks. until 2020, the french producer was a slightly above-average dubstep artist who i wouldn’t have given a second look.
